alert.note: Alert for Northern Oxford; Southern Oxford (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued February 22 at 3:25AM EST until February 23 at 1:00AM EST by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: .Rain combined with warm temperatures will increase snowmelt and runoff into area streams and rivers tonight and Wednesday. This will lead to river rises and possible ice movement which will increase the potential for ice jams. ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by rain and/or snowmelt and/or ice jam continues to be possible. * WHERE...Portions of western Maine, including the following areas, Northern Oxford and Southern Oxford. Portions of New Hampshire, including the following areas, Northern Carroll, Northern Coos, Northern Grafton, Southern Carroll, Southern Coos, Southern Grafton and Sullivan. * WHEN...From late tonight through Thursday morning. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
